alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Central; Baldwin Coastal; Baldwin Inland; Butler; Conecuh; Covington; Escambia; Mobile Central; Mobile Coastal; Mobile Inland; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 4:02AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Butler, southwestern Monroe, Mobile, Baldwin, Escambia, Conecuh, northwestern Covington, northwestern Okaloosa, Santa Rosa and Escambia Counties through 500 AM CST... At 401 AM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from I65 And AL 113 to 5 miles east of I65 And AL 225 to near Prichard to near Coden. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Midtown Mobile, Downtown Mobile, Prichard, Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Tillmans Corner, Warrington, Saraland, Gonzalez, Bay Minette, Atmore, Foley, Pace, Milton, Monroeville, Theodore, Chickasaw and Satsuma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama...and northwestern Florida.
